lines.value: brasil (, ), lonibiṣẹ́ bii orilẹ̀-ede olominira aparapọ̀ ilẹ̀ brasil federative republic of brazil (, ), ni orilẹ̀-ede totobijulọ ni guusi amẹ́rika ati ni agbegbe amẹ́rika latini
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: okowo rẹ̀ ni ikaarun totobijulọ lagbaye gegebi ala jeografi ati bii alabugbe pelu 193 million eniyan
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: brasil ni orile ede it is the largest eledeluso totobijulo lagbaye ati ikan soso ni orile awon amerika
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: o ni bode mo okun atlantiki ni ilaorun brasil ni etiomi to to
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: o ni bode ni ariwa pelu venezuela guyana suriname ati agbegbe okere fransi ni guiana fransi ni ariwaiwoorun pelu kolombia ni iwoorun pelu bolivia ati peru ni guusuiwoorun pelu argentina ati paraguay ati ni guusu pelu uruguay

lines.value: opo awon erekusu osupo wa ni ara ile brasil bi fernando de noronha rocas atoll saint peter and paul rocks ati trindade and martim vaz

lines.value: o ni bode mo gbogbo awon orile ede guusu amerika ayafi ekuador ati tsile

lines.value: brasil tele je imusin portugal latigba ti pedro alvares cabral gunle sibe ni 1500 titi di 1815 nigba to di ileoba ati ileoba asokan portugal brasil ati awon algafe je didasile
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: ibase amusin na je gige ni 1808 nigbati oluilu ileobaluaye alamusin portugal je gbigbe kuro ni lisbon lo si rio de janeiro leyin igba ti napoleon gbogunlu portugal
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: brasil gba ilominira ni 1822 pelu idasile ileobaluaye ile brasil orile ede abasokan pelu iru ijoba kabiyesi onilanairepo ati sistemu onileasofin
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: brasil orile ede olominira oniare ni 1889 nigba ti ifipagbajoba ologun sakede orile ede olominira botilejepe ileasofin oniyewu meji loni to n je kongresi ti wa lati igba itowobowe ilanairepo akoko ni 1824

lines.value: ilanairepo brasil loni to je dida ni 1988 pe brasil ni orile ede olominira apapo
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: iparapo orile ede na waye pelu isokan larin agbegbe ijoba apapo awon ipinle 26 ati awon agbegbe ibile 5564

lines.value: okowo brasil ni ikefa totobijulo lagbaye gegebi gdp oloruko ati ikeje totobijulo gegebi osuwon agbara inawo titi de 2011

lines.value: awon atunse okowo to waye ti fun ni idamo tuntun kariaye
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: brasil je omoegbe oludasile awon orile ede asokan g20 cplp isokan latini agbajo awon orile ede iberia amerika agbajo awon orile ede amerika mercosul ati isokan awon orile ede guusu amerika ati ikan ninu awon orile ede bric
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: bakana brasil tun je ikan ninu awon awon orile ede olohun orisirisi 17 ibe je ile fun awon orisi eran igbe ayika adanida opo awon alumoni adanida nibi orisi ibi abo
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: pelu awon eya 67 abinibi ti won da duro brasil ni iye awon eniyan aitibapade to pojulo lagbaye

lines.value: oruko re bi brasil wa lati oruko igi brasil igi kan to n wu nigbakan ni janti rere leti eba omi brasil

lines.value: ni ede portugal igi brasil unje pau brasil nibi ti brasil ti tumo si pupa bi ojuina lati ede latin brasa ember ati alemeyin il lati iculum tabi ilium

lines.value: nitoripe igi brasil se da aro pupa o niyi daada ni europe lati fi kun aso ohun si ni aje akoko to wulo lati brasil
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: kakiri igba orundun 16k opo igi brasil je fifatu latowo awon eniya abinibi agaga awon tupi leba etiomi brasil awon yi si ta won fun awon onibukata ara europe agaga awon ara portugal ati fun awon ara fransi fun pasiparo fun orisi oja amulo lati europe
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: oruko onibise ile yi ninu awon akosile awon ara portugal je was the ile agbelebu mimo land of the holy cross terra da santa cruz sugbon awon awako ojuomi ati oloja ara europe unsaba pe lasan bi ile brasil land of brazil terra do brasil nitori bukata igi brasil

lines.value: oruko yi lo gbajumo titi do ni to fi ropo oruko onibise
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: bakanna awon awako ojuomi nibere pe ibe ni ile awon odidere land of parrots terra di papaga

lines.value: ni ede guarani ti se ede onibise kan ni paraguay brasil unje pipe ni pindorama
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: oruko yi ni awon eniyan abinibi fun agbegbe yi itumo re ni ile awon igi ọ̀pẹ land of the palm trees

lines.value: ori ile ti a mo loni bi brasil je gbigbesele latowo portugal ni april 1500 nigba ti oko ojuomi lati portugal ti pedro alvares cabral dari gunle
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: awon wonyi pade awon are ibe ti ede opo won je ti tupi guarani
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: botilejepe ilu abudo akoko je didasile ni 1532 imusin ko bere titi to fi di 1534 nigbati oba dom joao 3k ile portugal pin ibe si ile basorun ajogun mejila
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: eto yi ko ni yori i rere rara bosi ti di odun 1549 oba yan gomina agba kan lati samojuto gbogbo ibe
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: awon eya abinibi bi melo kan je fifamora awon miran je kikoleru tabi piparun ninu ogun tabi pelu awon arun ti awon ara europe ko ran won ti ara won ko ni ajesara si
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: nigba ti yio fi di arin orundun 16k suga ti di oja okere pataki fun brasil nitori awon ara portugal yi ko opo eru wa lati afrika lati fi won sise fun ibere oja suga to unpo si kariaye
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: nipa gbigbogun ti awon ara fransi awon ara portugal diedie fe ile won de guusuilaorun won si gbesele ilu rio de janeiro ni 1567 ati de ariwaiwoorun nibi ti won ti gbesele ilu sao luis ni 1615
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: won ran awon ologun losi igbo aginju amasoni won si bori awon ajagun britani ati holandi to wa nibe ki won o to bere sini da abule ati ile ologun sibe lati 1669
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: ni 1680 won de guusu nibi ti won da sacramento sile si ni eba rio de la plata ni agbegbe etiomi apailaorun region
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: ni opin orundun 17k oja suga ni okere bere si ni re sile sugbon lati ibere awon odun 1690 iwari wura latowo awon oluwakiri ni agbegbe na to unje pipe ni minas gerais ni mato grosso ati goias loni gba ibi amusin na la lowo iparun
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: kakiri lati brasil ati lati portugal egbeegberun eniyan tu wa si koto alumoni lati wa sise
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: awon ara spein gbira lati dena awon ara portugal lati fe ile won de ori ile to je ti won gegebi adehun tordesillas 1494 won si yori lati gbesele etiomi apailaorun ni 1777
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: sibesibe asan ni eyi jasi gegebi adehun san ildefonso ti won fowosi lodun kanna yi sedaju ase portugal lori gbogbo awon ile ti won ba gbesele ati igba yi ni opo gbogbo bode brasil loni ti wa
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: ni 1808 ebi ile oba portugal ati opo awon ijoye portugal lati bo lowo awon ajagun napoleon i lati fransi ti won ungbogun ti portugal ati gbogbo arin gbongan europe ko ara won lo si ilu rio de janeiro to fi be di ibujoko gbogbo ileobaluaye portugal
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: ni 1815 dom joao 6k gege bi aruobaje dipo iya re gbe brasil soke lati ibi amusin di alase kingdom united with portugal|ileoba asokan ile portugal brasil ati awon algarfe
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: ni 1809 awon ara portugal na tun gbogun ti guiana fransi ti won da pada fun fransi ni 1817 be sini ni 1816 won yi orunko etiomi apailaorun si cisplatina
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: after the portuguese military had successfully repelled napoleon's invasion joao vi returned to europe in april 1821 leaving his elder son prince pedro de alcantara as regent to rule brazil
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the portuguese government guided by the new political regime imposed by the liberal revolution of 1820 attempted to turn brazil into a colony once again thus depriving it of its achievements since 1808
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the brazilians refused to yield and prince pedro stood by them declaring the country's independence from portugal on 7 september 1822
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: on 12 october 1822 he was declared the first emperor of brazil and crowned dom pedro i on 1 december 1822
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: at that time most brazilians were in favour of a monarchy and republicanism had little support
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the subsequent brazilian war of independence spread through almost the entire territory with battles in the northern northeastern and southern regions
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the last portuguese soldiers surrendered on 8 march 1824 and independence was recognized by portugal on 29 august 1825
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: pedro i abdicated on 7 april 1831 and went to europe to reclaim his daughter's crown which had been usurped by his brother leaving behind his five year old son and heir who became dom pedro ii
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: as the new emperor could not exert his constitutional powers until he reached maturity a regency was created
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: disputes between political factions led to rebellions and an unstable almost anarchical regency
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the rebellious factions however were not in revolt against the monarchy even though some declared the secession of the provinces as independent republics but only so long as pedro ii was a minor
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: because of this he was prematurely declared of age and brazil was to enjoy nearly half a century of internal peace and rapid material progress despite the loss of cisplatina in 1828 when it became an independent nation known as uruguay brazil won three international wars during the 58-year reign of pedro ii the platine war the uruguayan war and the paraguayan war and witnessed the consolidation of representative democracy mainly due to successive elections and unrestricted freedom of the press
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: most importantly slavery was extinguished after a slow but steady process that began with the end of the international traffic in slaves in 1850 and ended with the complete abolition of slavery in 1888
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the slave population had been in decline since brazil's independence in 1823 29% of the brazilian population were slaves but by 1887 this had fallen to 5%
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: when the monarchy was overthrown on 15 november 1889 there was little desire in brazil to change the form of government and pedro ii was at the height of his popularity among his subjects
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: however he bore prime perhaps sole responsibility for his own overthrow after the death of his two sons the emperor believed that the imperial regime was destined to end with him he cared little for the regime's fate and so neither did anything nor allowed anyone else to do anything to prevent the military coup backed by former slave owners who resented the abolition of slavery
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: adeyemo akinloye steve akọ́silẹ̀ diẹ̀ lori i igbe aye ọmọ yoruba ilẹ̀ brazil kan ti o fi igbe aye rẹ̀ tako owo ẹru lati ọwọ́ : asa j davis alaga gbogbo ẹ̀yin ọ̀fọ̀ọ̀kun iyi nla ni fun mi lati wa ni ijokoo lonii lati sọ̀rọ̀ lori ilaju yoruba
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: bi o tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pe mo ṣiṣẹ́ ri ni ọgba fasiti ibadan n ko ro wi pe mo yẹ ni emi ti o le maa ka apilẹ̀kọ lori ọ̀rọ̀ ilaju yoruba mo le ti ṣe awọn iwadii ti o jẹ mọ́ akori yii loootọ́ fun awọn akoko kan bi a ba fi oju inu wo ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ninu awa atọ̀hunrinwa ni a ti n ṣe iwadii orirun wa de ilẹ̀ yoruba
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: ọ̀pọ̀ oniwadii ijinlẹ̀ ni wọ́n kọ ipakọ́ si iwadii opin ọ̀rọ̀ ẹru ni ilẹ̀ brazil bi o tilẹ̀ jẹ́ wi pe gbogbo ọgbọ́n alumọ̀kọ́rọ́yi ati agidi paraku lori owo ni o mu awọn ẹlẹ́nuugbọ̀rọ̀ dide lati maa tako owo ẹru ni ilẹ̀ brazil
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: a gbọ́dọ̀ mọ̀ lati ilẹ̀ wi pe ati dudu ati funfun ni wọ́n jọ pa ọwọ́ pọ̀ gbe ogun ti owo ẹru ṣugbọ́n ọ̀pọ̀ ni ko fi ara mọ́ atako yii
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: ọ̀kan ninu awọn ti o tako owo ẹru yii jẹ́ ọmọ yoruba ilẹ̀ brazil kan ẹ jẹ́ ki a wo isẹ̀lẹ̀ yii ni ọjọ́ kan ẹru alawọ̀ dudu kan jade ni ile olowo rẹ̀ o si lọ si ọ̀dọ̀ agbejọ́ro alawọ̀ dudu kan pẹ̀lu ọwọ́ ti agbẹ́jọ́ro yii yoo lo lati sọọ́ di ominira
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: tohun-tẹnue ni baba olowo ẹru wọ inu ọọ́fiisi agbẹjọ́ro ọ̀rẹ́ ẹ rẹ̀ yii ti o si bẹ̀rẹ̀ si i beere lọ́wọ́ ẹru yii idi ti o fi fẹ́ fi oun silẹ̀
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: o sọ siwaju wi pe oun n tẹ́ ẹ lọ́run ati wi pe ko yẹ ki o ba inujẹ́ rara niwọ̀n igba ti oun ti n ṣe bii baba fun un
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: ni tootọ́ ẹru yii n ri itọ́ju ko si si idi fun-un lati kun rara idi niyi ti ẹru yii ko fi ri atako kankan fun ọ̀rọ̀ olowo rẹ̀ yii
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: ṣugbọ́n ni igba ti agbẹjọ́ro yii ri i wi pe ẹru yii ko ri idahun ni o ba fọ esi wi pe : ni tootọ́ ẹru yii yoo gba itusilẹ̀ nitori pe ko ni ominira lati ba inu jẹ́ bi o ṣe wu u
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: armenia (;, siso hayastan ), officially the republic of armenia (, hayastani hanrapetut'yun ), je orile ede oke ile ti ile yika ni agbegbe kafkasu ni eurasia
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: o budo si oritameta apaiwoorun asia ati apailaorun europe armenia may be considered to be in asia and or europe
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the un classification of world regions places armenia in western asia the cia world factbook and also place armenia in asia
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: conversely some sources place armenia in europe such as oxford reference online and o ni bode mo turki ni iwoorun georgia ni ariwa de facto nagorno karabakh republic alominira ati azerbaijan ni ilaorun ati iran ati ile azerbaijani nakhchivan ni guusu
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: a former republic of the soviet union armenia is a unitary multiparty democratic nation state with an ancient and historic cultural heritage
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the kingdom of armenia became the first state to adopt christianity as its religion in the early years of the 4th century the traditional date is 301
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the modern republic of armenia recognizes the armenian apostolic church as the national church of armenia although the republic has separation of church and state
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: armenia is a member of more than 40 international organisations including the united nations the council of europe the asian development bank the commonwealth of independent states the world trade organization world customs organization the organization of the black sea economic cooperation and la francophonie
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: it is a member of the csto military alliance and also participates in nato's partnership for peace pfp programme
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: in 2004 its forces joined kfor a nato led international force in kosovo
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: it is also an observer member of the eurasian economic community and the non aligned movement
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the country is an emerging democracy and is currently in a negotiation process with the european union of which it may become an associate member in the near future
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the government of armenia holds european integration as a key priority in its foreign policy as it is considered a european country by the european union
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: west africa time or wat is a time zone used in west central africa though not in countries west of benin which instead use gmt
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the zone is one hour ahead of utc(coordinated universal time utc+1 which makes it the same as central european time
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: note that it does not include most of the countries that make up the west africa region these use utc+0
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: as most of this time zone is in the equatorial region there is no significant change in day length throughout the year so daylight saving time is not observed
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the exception to this is namibia which moves to west africa summer time utc+2 in the summer months september to april
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: eyi fa ala si ise hubble bi teliskopu oninuawopupa
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: perkin elmer intended to use custom built and extremely sophisticated computer controlled polishing machines to grind the mirror to the required shape
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: however in case their cutting edge technology ran into difficulties nasa demanded that pe sub contract to kodak to construct a back up mirror using traditional mirror polishing techniques
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the team of kodak and itek also bid on the original mirror polishing work
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: their bid called for the two companies to double check each other's work which would have almost certainly caught the polishing error that later caused such problems
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: ) the kodak mirror is now on permanent display at the smithsonian institution
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: an itek mirror built as part of the effort is now used in the 2.4 m telescope at the magdalena ridge observatory
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: construction of the perkin elmer mirror began in 1979 starting with a blank manufactured by corning from their ultra low expansion glass
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: to keep the mirror's weight to a minimum it consisted of inch thick top and bottom plates sandwiching a honeycomb lattice
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: perkin elmer simulated microgravity by supporting the mirror on both sides with 138 rods that exerted varying amounts of force
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this ensured that the mirror's final shape would be correct and to specification when finally deployed
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: mirror polishing continued until may 1981
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: nasa reports at the time questioned perkin elmer's managerial structure and the polishing began to slip behind schedule and over budget
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: to save money nasa halted work on the back up mirror and put the launch date of the telescope back to october 1984
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the mirror was completed by the end of 1981 it was washed using 2400 gallons 9100 l of hot deionized water and then received a reflective coating of aluminum 65 nm thick and a protective coating of magnesium fluoride 25 nm thick
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: doubts continued to be expressed about perkin elmer's competence on a project of this importance as their budget and timescale for producing the rest of the ota continued to inflate
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: in response to a schedule described as unsettled and changing daily nasa postponed the launch date of the telescope until april 1985
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: perkin elmer's schedules continued to slip at a rate of about one month per quarter and at times delays reached one day for each day of work
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: nasa was forced to postpone the launch date until march and then september 1986
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: by this time the total project budget had risen to us$1.175 billion
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the spacecraft in which the telescope and instruments were to be housed was another major engineering challenge
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: it would have to withstand frequent passages from direct sunlight into the darkness of earth's shadow which would cause major changes in temperature while being stable enough to allow extremely accurate pointing of the telescope
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: a shroud of multi layer insulation keeps the temperature within the telescope stable and surrounds a light aluminum shell in which the telescope and instruments sit
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: within the shell a graphite epoxy frame keeps the working parts of the telescope firmly aligned
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: because graphite composites are hygroscopic there was a risk that water vapor absorbed by the truss while in lockheed's clean room would later be expressed in the vacuum of space the telescope's instruments would be covered in ice
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: to reduce that risk a nitrogen gas purge was performed before launching the telescope into space
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: while construction of the spacecraft in which the telescope and instruments would be housed proceeded somewhat more smoothly than the construction of the ota lockheed still experienced some budget and schedule slippage and by the summer of 1985 construction of the spacecraft was 30% over budget and three months behind schedule
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: an msfc report said that lockheed tended to rely on nasa directions rather than take their own initiative in the construction
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: when launched the hst carried five scientific instruments the wide field and planetary camera wf/pc goddard high resolution spectrograph ghrs high speed photometer hsp faint object camera foc and the faint object spectrograph fos
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: wf/pc was a high resolution imaging device primarily intended for optical observations
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: it was built by nasa's jet propulsion laboratory and incorporated a set of 48 filters isolating spectral lines of particular astrophysical interest
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the instrument contained eight charge coupled device ccd chips divided between two cameras each using four ccds
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: each ccd has a resolution of 0.64 megapixels
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the wide field camera wfc covered a large angular field at the expense of resolution while the planetary camera pc took images at a longer effective focal length than the wf chips giving it a greater magnification
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the ghrs was a spectrograph designed to operate in the ultraviolet
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: it was built by the goddard space flight center and could achieve a spectral resolution of 90000
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: also optimized for ultraviolet observations were the foc and fos which were capable of the highest spatial resolution of any instruments on hubble
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: rather than ccds these three instruments used photon counting digicons as their detectors
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the foc was constructed by esa while the university of california san diego and the martin marietta corporation built the fos
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the final instrument was the hsp designed and built at the university of wisconsin madison
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: it was optimized for visible and ultraviolet light observations of variable stars and other astronomical objects varying in brightness
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: it could take up to 100000 measurements per second with a photometric accuracy of about 2% or better
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: hst's guidance system can also be used as a scientific instrument
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: its three fine guidance sensors fgs are primarily used to keep the telescope accurately pointed during an observation but can also be used to carry out extremely accurate astrometry measurements accurate to within 0.0003 arcseconds have been achieved
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the space telescope science institute stsci is responsible for the scientific operation of the telescope and delivery of data products to astronomers
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: stsci is operated by the association of universities for research in astronomy aura and is physically located in baltimore maryland on the homewood campus of johns hopkins university one of the 33 us universities and seven international affiliates that make up the aura consortium
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: stsci was established in 1981 after something of a power struggle between nasa and the scientific community at large
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: nasa had wanted to keep this function in house but scientists wanted it to be based in an academic establishment
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the space telescope european coordinating facility st-ecf established at garching bei munchen near munich in 1984 provides similar support for european astronomers
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: one rather complex task that falls to stsci is scheduling observations for the telescope
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: hubble is in a low earth orbit so that it can be reached by the space shuttle for servicing missions but this means that most astronomical targets are occulted by the earth for slightly less than half of each orbit
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: observations cannot take place when the telescope passes through the south atlantic anomaly due to elevated radiation levels and there are also sizable exclusion zones around the sun precluding observations of mercury moon and earth
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the solar avoidance angle is about 50° which is specified to keep sunlight from illuminating any part of the ota
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: earth and moon avoidance is to keep bright light out of the fgss and to keep scattered light from entering the instruments
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: if the fgss are turned off however the moon and earth can be observed
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: earth observations were used very early in the program to generate flat fields for the wfpc1 instrument
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: there is a so called continuous viewing zone cvz at roughly 90 degrees to the plane of hubble's orbit in which targets are not occulted for long periods
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: due to the precession of the orbit the location of the cvz moves slowly over a period of eight weeks
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: because the of the earth is always within about 30° of regions within the cvz the brightness of scattered earthshine may be elevated for long periods during cvz observations
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: because hubble orbits in the upper atmosphere its orbit changes over time in a way that is not accurately predictable
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the density of the upper atmosphere varies according to many factors and this means that hubble's predicted position for six weeks time could be in error by up to 4000 km
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: observation schedules are typically finalized only a few days in advance as a longer lead time would mean there was a chance that the target would be unobservable by the time it was due to be observed
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: engineering support for hst is provided by nasa and contractor personnel at the goddard space flight center in greenbelt maryland 48 km south of the stsci
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: hubble's operation is monitored 24 hours per day by four teams of flight controllers who make up hubble's flight operations team
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: by early 1986 the planned launch date of october that year looked feasible but the challenger accident brought the us space program to a halt grounding the space shuttle fleet and forcing the launch of hubble to be postponed for several years
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the telescope had to be kept in a clean room powered up and purged with nitrogen until a launch could be rescheduled
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this costly situation about $6 million per month pushed the overall costs of the project even higher
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this delay did allow time for engineers to perform extensive tests swap out a possibly failure prone battery and make other improvements
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: furthermore the ground software needed to control hubble was not ready in 1986 and in fact was barely ready by the 1990 launch
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: eventually following the resumption of shuttle flights in 1988 the launch of the telescope was scheduled for 1990
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: on april 24 1990 shuttle mission sts 31 saw discovery launch the telescope successfully into its planned orbit
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: from its original total cost estimate of about us$400 million the telescope had by now cost over $2.5 billion to construct
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: hubble's cumulative costs up to this day are estimated to be several times higher still with us expenditure estimated at between $4.5 and $6 billion and europe's financial contribution at €593 million 1999 estimate
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: within weeks of the launch of the telescope the returned images indicated a serious problem with the optical system
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: although the first images appeared to be sharper than those of ground based telescopes hubble failed to achieve a final sharp focus and the best image quality obtained was drastically lower than expected
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: images of point sources spread out over a radius of more than one arcsecond instead of having a point spread function psf concentrated within a circle 0.1 arcsec in diameter as had been specified in the design criteria
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: analysis of the flawed images showed that the cause of the problem was that the primary mirror had been ground to the wrong shape
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: although it was probably the most precisely figured mirror ever made with variations from the prescribed curve of only 10 nanometers at the perimeter it was too flat by about 2200 nanometers 2.2 micrometres
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this difference was catastrophic introducing severe spherical aberration a flaw in which light reflecting off the edge of a mirror focuses on a different point from the light reflecting off its center
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the effect of the mirror flaw on scientific observations depended on the particular observation the core of the aberrated psf was sharp enough to permit high resolution observations of bright objects and spectroscopy was largely unaffected
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: however the loss of light to the large out of focus halo severely reduced the usefulness of the telescope for faint objects or high contrast imaging
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this meant that nearly all of the cosmological programs were essentially impossible since they required observation of exceptionally faint objects
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: nasa and the telescope became the butt of many jokes and the project was popularly regarded as a white elephant
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: for instance in the 1991 comedy the naked gun 2½ the smell of fear the hubble was pictured with thetitanic the hindenburg and the edsel
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: nonetheless during the first three years of the hubble mission before the optical corrections the telescope still carried out a large number of productive observations
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the error was well characterized and stable enabling astronomers to optimize the results obtained using sophisticated image processing techniques such as deconvolution
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: a commission headed by lew allen director of the jet propulsion laboratory was established to determine how the error could have arisen
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the allen commission found that the main null corrector a testing device used to achieve a properly shaped non spherical mirror had been incorrectly assembled one lens was wrongly spaced by 1.3 mm
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: during the initial grinding and polishing of the mirror perkin elmer analyzed its surface with two conventional null correctors
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: however for the final manufacturing step figuring they switched to a custom built null corrector designed explicitly to meet very strict tolerances
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: ironically this device was mis assembled resulting in an extremely precise but wrong shape for the mirror
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: there was one final opportunity to catch the error since a few of the final tests needed to use conventional null correctors for various technical reasons
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: these tests correctly indicated spherical aberration
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: however the company ignored these results as it believed they were less accurate than the primary device which reported that the mirror was perfectly figured
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the commission blamed the failings primarily on perkin elmer
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: relations between nasa and the optics company had been severely strained during the telescope construction due to frequent schedule slippage and cost overruns
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: nasa found that perkin elmer did not review or supervise the mirror construction adequately did not assign its best optical scientists to the project as it had for the prototype and in particular did not involve the optical designers in the construction and verification of the mirror
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: while the commission heavily criticized perkin elmer for these managerial failings nasa was also criticized for not picking up on the quality control shortcomings such as relying totally on test results from a single instrument
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the design of the telescope had always incorporated servicing missions and astronomers immediately began to seek potential solutions to the problem that could be applied at the first servicing mission scheduled for 1993
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: while kodak and itek had each ground back up mirrors for hubble it would have been impossible to replace the mirror in orbit and too expensive and time consuming to bring the telescope back to earth for a refit
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: instead the fact that the mirror had been ground so precisely to the wrong shape led to the design of new optical components with exactly the same error but in the opposite sense to be added to the telescope at the servicing mission effectively acting as spectacles to correct the spherical aberration
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the first step was a precise characterization of the error in the main mirror
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: working backwards from images of point sources astronomers determined that the conic constant of the mirror as built was −1.01390±0.0002 instead of the intended −1.00230
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the same number was also derived by analyzing the null corrector used by perkin elmer to figure the mirror as well as by analyzing interferograms obtained during ground testing of the mirror
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: because of the way the hst's instruments were designed two different sets of correctors were required
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the design of the wide field and planetary camera 2 already planned to replace the existing wf/pc included relay mirrors to direct light onto the eight separate ccd chips making up its two cameras
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: an inverse error built into their surfaces could completely cancel the aberration of the primary
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: however the other instruments lacked any intermediate surfaces that could be figured in this way and so required an external correction device
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the corrective optics space telescope axial replacement costar system was designed to correct the spherical aberration for light focused at the foc fos and ghrs
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: it consists of two mirrors in the light path with one ground to correct the aberration
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: to fit the costar system onto the telescope one of the other instruments had to be removed and astronomers selected the high speed photometer to be sacrificed
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: by 2002 all of the original instruments requiring costar had been replaced by instruments with their own corrective optics
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: costar was removed and returned to earth in 2009 where it is exhibited at the national air and space museum
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the area previously used by costar is now occupied by the cosmic origins spectrograph
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: <div style="float right clear right margin 0 0 1em 1em padding 3px;"> imagesize= width:420 height:170 plotarea = width:400 height:150 left:10 bottom:20 alignbars = justify colors = id:lightgray value:gray(0.999999 id:darkgray value:gray(0.2 id:ren value:rgb(0.61,1 id:bar value:rgb(0.61,0.6 id:cla value:rgb(11,0.6 backgroundcolors= canvas:lightgray period = from:1990 till:2011 timeaxis = orientation:horizontal scalemajor= unit:year increment:5 start:1990 gridcolor:darkgray plotdata= bar from:1990 till:1993 color:ren text:wfpc from:1993 till:2009 color:bar text:wfpc2 from:2009 till:2011 color:cla text:wfc3 bar from:1990 till:1997 color:ren text:ghrs from:1997 till:2011 color:bar text:nicmos bar from:1990 till:1993 color:ren text:hsp from:1993 till:2009 color:bar text:costar from:2009 till:2011 color:cla text:cos bar from:1990 till:2002 color:ren text:foc from:2002 till:2011 color:bar text:acs bar from:1990 till:1997 color:ren text:fos from:1997 till:2011 color:bar text:stis hubble was designed to accommodate regular servicing and equipment upgrades
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: five servicing missions sm 1 2 3a 3b and 4 were flown by nasa space shuttles the first in december 1993 and the last in may 2009
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: servicing missions were delicate operations that began with maneuvering to intercept the telescope in orbit and carefully retrieving it with the shuttle's mechanical arm
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the necessary work was then carried out in multiple tethered spacewalks over a period of four to five days
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: after a visual inspection of the telescope astronauts conducted repairs replaced failed or degraded components upgraded equipment and installed new instruments
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: once work was completed the telescope was redeployed typically after boosting to a higher orbit to address any orbital decay caused by atmospheric drag
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: after the problems with hubble's mirror came to light the first servicing mission assumed a much greater importance as the astronauts would have to carry out extensive work on the telescope to install the corrective optics
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the seven astronauts selected for the mission were trained intensively in the use of the hundred or more specialized tools that would be needed
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: sm1 flew aboard endeavour in december 1993 and involved installation of several instruments and other equipment over 10 days
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: most importantly the high speed photometer was replaced with the costar corrective optics package and wfpc was replaced with the wide field and planetary camera 2 wfpc2 with its internal optical correction system
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: in addition the solar arrays and their drive electronics were replaced as well as four of the gyroscopes used in the telescope pointing system two electrical control units and other electrical components and two magnetometers
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the onboard computers were upgraded and the telescope's orbit was boosted
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: on january 13 1994 nasa declared the mission a complete success and showed the first of many much sharper images
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: at the time the mission was one of the most complex ever undertaken involving five lengthy periods of extra vehicular activity and its resounding success was an enormous boon for nasa as well as for the astronomers who now had a fully capable space telescope
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: servicing mission 2 flown by discovery in february 1997 replaced the ghrs and the fos with the space telescope imaging spectrograph stis and the near infrared camera and multi object spectrometer nicmos replaced an engineering and science tape recorder with a new solid state recorder and repaired thermal insulation
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: nicmos contained a heat sink of solid nitrogen to reduce the thermal noise from the instrument but shortly after it was installed an unexpected thermal expansion resulted in part of the heat sink coming into contact with an optical baffle
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this led to an increased warming rate for the instrument and reduced its original expected lifetime of 4.5 years to about 2 years
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: servicing mission 3a flown by discovery took place in december 1999 and was a split off from servicing mission 3 after three of the six onboard gyroscopes had failed
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: a fourth failed a few weeks before the mission rendering the telescope incapable of performing scientific observations
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the mission replaced all six gyroscopes replaced a fine guidance sensor and the computer installed a voltage temperature improvement kit vik to prevent battery overcharging and replaced thermal insulation blankets
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the new computer is 20 times faster with six times more memory than the df 224 it replaced
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: it increases throughput by moving some computing tasks from the ground to the spacecraft and saves money by allowing the use of modern programming languages
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: servicing mission 3b flown by columbia in march 2002 saw the installation of a new instrument with the foc the last original instrument being replaced by theadvanced camera for surveys acs
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this meant that costar was no longer required since all new instruments had built in correction for the main mirror aberration
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the mission also revived nicmos and replaced the solar arrays for the second time providing 30 percent more power
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: plans called for hubble to be serviced in february 2005 but the columbia disaster in 2003 in which columbia disintegrated on reentry into the atmosphere had wide ranging effects on the hubble program
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: nasa administrator sean o'keefe decided that all future shuttle missions had to be able to reach the safe haven of the international space station should in flight problems develop
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: as no shuttles were capable of reaching both hst and the iss during the same mission future manned service missions were canceled
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this decision was assailed by numerous astronomers who felt that hubble was valuable enough to merit the human risk
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: hst's planned successor the james webb telescope is not expected to launch until at least 2018
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: a gap in space observing capabilities between a decommissioning of hubble and the commissioning of a successor is of major concern to many astronomers given the significant scientific impact of hst
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the consideration that jwst will not be located in low earth orbit and therefore cannot be easily upgraded or repaired in the event of an early failure only makes these concerns more acute
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: on the other hand many astronomers felt strongly that the servicing of hubble should not take place if the expense were to come from the jwst budget
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: in january 2004 o'keefe said he would review his decision to cancel the final servicing mission to hst due to public outcry and requests from congress for nasa to look for a way to save it
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the national academy of sciences convened an official panel which recommended in july 2004 that the hst should be preserved despite the apparent risks
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: their report urged nasa should take no actions that would preclude a space shuttle servicing mission to the hubble space telescope
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: in august 2004 o'keefe asked goddard space flight center to prepare a detailed proposal for a robotic service mission
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: these plans were later canceled the robotic mission being described as not feasible
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: in late 2004 several congressional members led by senator barbara mikulski held public hearings and carried on a fight with much public support including thousands of letters from school children across the country to get the bush administration and nasa to reconsider the decision to drop plans for a hubble rescue mission
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the nomination in april 2005 of a new nasa administrator michael d griffin changed the situation as griffin stated he would consider a manned servicing mission
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: soon after his appointment griffin authorized goddard to proceed with preparations for a manned hubble maintenance flight saying he would make the final decision after the next two shuttle missions
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: in october 2006 griffin gave the final go ahead and the 11-day mission by atlantis was scheduled for october 2008
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: hubble's main data handling unit failed in september 2008 halting all reporting of scientific data until its back up was brought online on october 25 2008
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: since a failure of the backup unit would leave the hst helpless the service mission was postponed to incorporate a replacement for the primary unit
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: servicing mission 4 flown by atlantis in may 2009 was the last scheduled shuttle mission for hst
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: sm4 installed the replacement data handling unit repaired the acs and stis systems installed improved nickel hydrogen batteries and replaced other components
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: sm4 also installed two new observation instruments wide field camera 3 wtf3 and the cosmic origins spectrograph(cos -and the soft capture and rendezvous system which will enable the future rendezvous capture and safe disposal of hubble by either a crewed or robotic mission
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the work accomplished during sm4 is expected to render the telescope fully functioning at least into the year 2014 and perhaps longer
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: in the early 1980s nasa and stsci convened four panels to discuss key projects
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: these were projects that were both scientifically important and would require significant telescope time which would be explicitly dedicated to each project
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this guaranteed that these particular projects would be completed early in case the telescope failed sooner than expected
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the panels identified three such projects 1 a study of the nearby intergalactic medium using quasar absorption lines to determine the properties of the intergalactic medium and the gaseous content of galaxies and groups of galaxies 2 a medium deep survey using the wide field camera to take data whenever one of the other instruments was being used and 3 a project to determine the hubble constant within ten percent by reducing the errors both external and internal in the calibration of the distance scale
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the hubble has helped to resolve some long standing problems in astronomy as well as turning up results that have required new theories to explain them
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: among its primary mission targets was to measure distances to cepheid variable stars more accurately than ever before and thus constrain the value of the hubble constant the measure of the rate at which the universe is expanding which is also related to its age
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: before the launch of hst estimates of the hubble constant typically had errors of up to 50% but hubble measurements of cepheid variables in the virgo cluster and other distant galaxy clusters provided a measured value with an accuracy of ±10% which is consistent with other more accurate measurements made since hubble's launch using other techniques
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: while hubble helped to refine estimates of the age of the universe it also cast doubt on theories about its future
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: astronomers from the high z supernova search team and the supernova cosmology project used the telescope to observe distant supernovae and uncovered evidence that far from decelerating under the influence of gravity the expansion of the universe may in fact be accelerating
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this acceleration was later measured more accurately by other ground based and space based telescopes confirming hubble's finding
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the cause of this acceleration remains poorly understood the most common cause attributed is dark energy
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the high resolution spectra and images provided by the hst have been especially well suited to establishing the prevalence of black holes in the nuclei of nearby galaxies
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: while it had been hypothesized in the early 1960s that black holes would be found at the centers of some galaxies and work in the 1980s identified a number of good black hole candidates it fell to work conducted with hubble to show that black holes are probably common to the centers of all galaxies
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the hubble programs further established that the masses of the nuclear black holes and properties of the galaxies are closely related
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the legacy of the hubble programs on black holes in galaxies is thus to demonstrate a deep connection between galaxies and their central black holes
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the collision of comet shoemaker levy 9 with jupiter in 1994 was fortuitously timed for astronomers coming just a few months after servicing mission 1 had restored hubble's optical performance
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: hubble images of the planet were sharper than any taken since the passage of voyager 2 in 1979 and were crucial in studying the dynamics of the collision of a comet with jupiter an event believed to occur once every few centuries
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: other major discoveries made using hubble data include proto planetary disks proplyds in the orion nebula evidence for the presence of extrasolar planets around sun like stars and the optical counterparts of the still mysterious gamma ray bursts
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: hst has also been used to study objects in the outer reaches of the solar system including the dwarf planets pluto and eris
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: a unique legacy of hubble are the hubble deep field hubble ultra deep field and hubble extreme deep field images which utilized hubble's unmatched sensitivity at visible wavelengths to create images of small patches of sky that are the deepest ever obtained at optical wavelengths
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the images reveal galaxies billions of light years away and have generated a wealth of scientific papers providing a new window on the early universe
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the non standard object scp 06f6 was discovered by the hubble space telescope in february 2006
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: during june and july 2012 us astronomers using hubble discovered a tiny fifth moon moving around icy pluto
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: many objective measures show the positive impact of hubble data on astronomy
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: over 9000 papers based on hubble data have been published in peer reviewed journals and countless more have appeared in conference proceedings
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: looking at papers several years after their publication about one third of all astronomy papers have no citations while only 2% of papers based on hubble data have no citations
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: on average a paper based on hubble data receives about twice as many citations as papers based on non hubble data
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: of the 200 papers published each year that receive the most citations about 10% are based on hubble data
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: although the hst has clearly helped astronomical research its financial cost has been large
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: a study on the relative astronomical benefits of different sizes of telescopes found that while papers based on hst data generate 15 times as many citations as a 4 m ground based telescope such as the william herschel telescope the hst costs about 100 times as much to build and maintain
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: deciding between building ground versus space based telescopes is complex
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: even before hubble was launched specialized ground based techniques such as aperture masking interferometry had obtained higher resolution optical and infrared images than hubble would achieve though restricted to targets about 10 8 times brighter than the faintest targets observed by hubble
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: since then advances in adaptive optics have extended the high resolution imaging capabilities of ground based telescopes to the infrared imaging of faint objects
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the usefulness of adaptive optics versus hst observations depends strongly on the particular details of the research questions being asked
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: in the visible bands adaptive optics can only correct a relatively small field of view whereas hst can conduct high resolution optical imaging over a wide field
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: only a small fraction of astronomical objects are accessible to high resolution ground based imaging in contrast hubble can perform high resolution observations of any part of the night sky and on objects that are extremely faint
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: anyone can apply for time on the telescope there are no restrictions on nationality or academic affiliation
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: competition for time on the telescope is intense and only about one fifth of the proposals submitted in each cycle earn time on the schedule
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: calls for proposals are issued roughly annually with time allocated for a cycle lasting about one year
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: proposals are divided into several categories general observer proposals are the most common covering routine observations
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: snapshot observations are those in which targets require only 45 minutes or less of telescope time including overheads such as acquiring the target snapshot observations are used to fill in gaps in the telescope schedule that cannot be filled by regular go programs
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: astronomers may make target of opportunity proposals in which observations are scheduled if a transient event covered by the proposal occurs during the scheduling cycle
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: in addition up to 10% of the telescope time is designated director's discretionary dd time
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: astronomers can apply to use dd time at any time of year and it is typically awarded for study of unexpected transient phenomena such as supernovae
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: other uses of dd time have included the observations that led to the production of the hubble deep field and hubble ultra deep field and in the first four cycles of telescope time observations carried out by amateur astronomers
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the first director of stsci riccardo giacconi announced in 1986 that he intended to devote some of his director discretionary time to allowing amateur astronomers to use the telescope
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the total time to be allocated was only a few hours per cycle but excited great interest among amateur astronomers
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: proposals for amateur time were stringently peer reviewed by a committee of leading amateur astronomers and time was awarded only to proposals that were deemed to have genuine scientific merit did not duplicate proposals made by professionals and required the unique capabilities of the space telescope
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: in total 13 amateur astronomers were awarded time on the telescope with observations being carried out between 1990 and 1997
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: one such study was transition comets - uv search for oh emissions in asteroids
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the very first proposal a hubble space telescope study of post eclipse brightening and albedo changes on io was published in icarus a journal devoted to solar system studies
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: after that time however budget reductions at stsci made the support of work by amateur astronomers untenable and no further amateur programs have been carried out
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the hubble telescope celebrated its 20th anniversary in space on april 22 2010
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: to commemorate the occasion nasa esa and space telescope institute stsci released an image from the carina nebula
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: hubble data was initially stored on the spacecraft
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: when launched the storage facilities were old fashioned reel to reel tape recorders but these were replaced by solid state data storage facilities during servicing missions 2 and 3a
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: about twice daily the hubble space telescope radios data to a satellite in the geosynchronous tracking and data relay satellite system which then downlinks the science data to one of two 60-foot 18-meter diameter high gain microwave antennas located at the white sands test facility in white sands new mexico
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: from there they are sent to the space telescope operations control center at goddard space flight center and finally to the space telescope science institute for archiving
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: each week hst downlinks approximately 120 gigabytes of data
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: all hubble data is eventually made available via the archives at stsci cadc and eso
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: data is usually proprietary available only to the principal investigator pi and astronomers designated by the pi for one year after being taken
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the pi can apply to the director of the stsci to extend or reduce the proprietary period in some circumstances
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: observations made on director's discretionary time are exempt from the proprietary period and are released to the public immediately
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: calibration data such as flat fields and dark frames are also publicly available straight away
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: all data in the archive is in the fits format which is suitable for astronomical analysis but not for public use
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the hubble heritage project processes and releases to the public a small selection of the most striking images in jpeg and tiff formats
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: astronomical data taken with ccds must undergo several calibration steps before they are suitable for astronomical analysis
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: stsci has developed sophisticated software that automatically calibrates data when they are requested from the archive using the best calibration files available
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this on the fly processing means that large data requests can take a day or more to be processed and returned
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the process by which data are calibrated automatically is known as pipeline reduction and is increasingly common at major observatories
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: astronomers may if they wish retrieve the calibration files themselves and run the pipeline reduction software locally
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this may be desirable when calibration files other than those selected automatically need to be used
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: hubble data can be analysed using many different packages
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: stsci maintains the custom made stsdas space telescope science data analysis system software which contains all the programs needed to run pipeline reduction on raw data files as well as many other astronomical image processing tools tailored to the requirements of hubble data
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the software runs as a module of iraf a popular astronomical data reduction program
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: it has always been important for the space telescope to capture the public's imagination given the considerable contribution of taxpayers to its construction and operational costs
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: after the difficult early years when the faulty mirror severely dented hubble's reputation with the public the first servicing mission allowed its rehabilitation as the corrected optics produced numerous remarkable images
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: several initiatives have helped to keep the public informed about hubble activities
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the hubble heritage project was established to provide the public with high quality images of the most interesting and striking objects observed
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the heritage team is composed of amateur and professional astronomers as well as people with backgrounds outside astronomy and emphasizes the aesthetic nature of hubble images
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the heritage project is granted a small amount of time to observe objects which for scientific reasons may not have images taken at enough wavelengths to construct a full color image
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: stsci maintains several comprehensive websites for the general public containing hubble images and information about the observatory
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the outreach efforts are coordinated by the office for public outreach which was established in 2000 to ensure that us taxpayers saw the benefits of their investment in the space telescope program
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: since 1999 the leading hubble outreach group in europe has been the hubble european space agency information centre heic
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this office was established at the space telescope european coordinating facility in munich germany
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: heic's mission is to fulfill hst outreach and education tasks for the european space agency
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the work is centered on the production of news and photo releases that highlight interesting hubble results and images
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: these are often european in origin and so increase awareness of both esa's hubble share 15% and the contribution of european scientists to the observatory
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: esa produces innovative educational material including a videocast series called hubblecast designed to share world class scientific news with the public
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the hubble space telescope has won two space achievement awards from the space foundation for its outreach activities in 2001 and 2010
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: there is a replica of the hubble telescope on the courthouse lawn in marshfield missouri the hometown of namesake edwin p hubble
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: past servicing missions have exchanged old instruments for new ones both avoiding failure and making possible new types of science
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: without servicing missions all of the instruments will eventually fail
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: in august 2004 the power system of the space telescope imaging spectrograph stis failed rendering the instrument inoperable
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the electronics had originally been fully redundant but the first set of electronics failed in may 2001
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this power supply was fixed during servicing mission 4 in may 2009
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: similarly the main camera the acs primary electronics failed in june 2006 and the power supply for the backup electronics failed on january 27 2007
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: only the instrument's solar blind channel sbc was operable using the side 1 electronics
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: a new power supply for the wide angle channel was added during sm 4 but quick tests revealed this did not help the high resolution channel
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: hst uses gyroscopes to stabilize itself in orbit and point accurately and steadily at astronomical targets
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: normally three gyroscopes are required for operation observations are still possible with two but the area of sky that can be viewed would be somewhat restricted and observations requiring very accurate pointing are more difficult
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: there are further contingency plans for observations with just one gyro but if all gyros fail continued scientific observations will not be possible
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: in 2005 it was decided to switch to two gyroscope mode for regular telescope operations as a means of extending the lifetime of the mission
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the switch to this mode was made in august 2005 leaving hubble with two gyroscopes in use two on backup and two inoperable
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: one more gyro failed in 2007
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: by the time of the final repair mission during which all six gyros were replaced with two new pairs and one refurbished pair only three gyros were still working
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: engineers are confident that they have identified the root causes of the gyro failures and the new models should be much more reliable
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: hubble orbits the earth in the extremely tenuous upper atmosphere and over time its orbit decays due to drag
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: if it is not reboosted by a shuttle or other means it will reenter the earth's atmosphere sometime between 2019 and 2032 with the exact date depending on how active the sun is and its impact on the upper atmosphere
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: if hubble were to descend in a completely uncontrolled reentry parts of the main mirror and its support structure would probably survive leaving the potential for damage or even human fatalities
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: nasa's original plan for safely de orbiting hubble was to retrieve it using a space shuttle
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the hubble telescope would then have most likely been displayed in the smithsonian institution
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this is no longer possible since the space shuttle fleet has been retired and would have been unlikely in any case due to the cost of the mission and risk to the crew
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: instead nasa considered adding an external propulsion module to allow controlled reentry
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: ultimately nasa installed the soft capture and rendezvous system to enable retrieval by either a crewed or robotic mission
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: there is no direct successor to the hubble as an ultraviolet and visible light space telescope as near term space telescopes do not duplicate hubble's wavelength coverage near-ultraviolet to near infrared wavelengths instead concentrating on the farther infrared bands
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: these bands are preferred for studying high redshift and low temperature objects objects generally older and farther away in the universe
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: these wavelengths are also difficult or impossible to study from the ground justifying the expense of a space based telescope
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: large ground based telescopes can image some of the same wavelengths as hubble sometimes challenge hst in terms of resolution via adaptive optics have much larger light gathering power and can be upgraded more easily but cannot yet match the hubble's excellent resolution over a wide field of view with the very dark background of space
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: plans for a hubble successor materialized as the next generation space telescope project which culminated in plans for the james webb space telescope jwst the formal successor of hubble
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: very different from a scaled up hubble it is designed to operate colder and farther away from the earth at the l2 lagrangian point where thermal and optical interference from the earth and moon are lessened
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: it is not engineered to be fully serviceable such as replaceable instruments but the design includes a docking ring to enable visits from other spacecraft
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: a main scientific goal of jwst is to observe the most distant objects in the universe beyond the reach of existing instruments
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: it is expected to detect stars in the early universe approximately 280 million years older than stars hst now detects
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the telescope is an international collaboration between nasa the european space agency and the canadian space agency since 1996 and is planned for launch on an ariane 5 rocket
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: although jwst is primarily an infrared instrument its coverage extends down to 600 nm wavelength light or roughly orange in the visible spectrum
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: a typical human eye can see to about 750 nm wavelength light so there is some overlap with the longest visible wavelength bands including orange and red light
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: a complementary telescope looking at even longer wavelengths than hubble or jwst is the european space agency's herschel space observatory launched on may 14 2009
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: like jwst herschel is not designed to be serviced after launch and has a mirror substantially larger than hubble's but observes only in the far infrared
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: further concepts for advanced 21st-century space telescopes include the advanced technology large aperture space telescope
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: , a conceptualized 8 to 16-meter 320 to 640-inch optical space telescope that if realized could be a more direct successor to hst with the ability to observe and photograph astronomical objects in the visible ultraviolet and infrared wavelengths with substantially better resolution than hubble or the spitzer space telescope
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: this effort is being planned for the 2025 2035 time frame
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: existing ground based telescopes and various proposed extremely large telescopes can exceed the hst in terms of sheer light gathering power and diffraction limit due to larger mirrors but other factors affect telescopes
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: in some cases they may be able to match or beat hubble in resolution by using adaptive optics ao
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: however ao on large ground based reflectors will not make hubble and other space telescopes obsolete
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: most ao systems sharpen the view over a very narrow field lucky cam for example produces crisp images just 10 to 20 wide whereas hubble's cameras are super sharp across a 2½ 150 field
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: furthermore space telescopes can study the heavens across the entire electromagnetic spectrum most of which is blocked by earth's atmosphere
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: finally the background sky is darker in space than on the ground because air absorbs solar energy during the day and then releases it at night producing a faint but nevertheless discernible airglow that washes out low contrast astronomical objects
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: profanation n ibajẹ́ isọdi aimọ́ ai'lọ́wọ̀ fun profane adj he used profane words o lo awọn ọ̀rọ̀ aimọ́ profane v.t sọ di aimọ́ they profane the name of god wọ́n sọ orukọ ọlọ́run di aimọ́ profanity n ibajẹ́ ailọ́wọ̀ a string of profanities came from his lips ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ibajẹ́ nm ti ẹnu rẹ̀ jade profess v.t and i jẹ́wọ́ sọ ni gbangba he professes islam o jẹ́wọ́ ẹ̀sin musulumi profession n ijẹ́wọ́ ipe iṣe he is a lawyer by profession iṣẹ́ agbẹjọ́ro ni ipe rẹ̀ professor n ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n olukọ́ nla ni ile ẹ̀kọ́ giga olukọ́ agba ni ile ẹ̀kọ́ giga he is professor of yoruba language ojọ̀gbọ́n ede yoruba ni proffer v.t fi bun fi tọrẹ la han proficiency n ilọsiwaju imipe he obtained a certificate of proficiency o gbe ewe-ẹ̀ri imupe proficient adj yiyẹ tito pipeprofile n aworan ori tabi oju aworan ẹ̀gbẹ́ oru tabi oju i saw a portrait drawn in profile mo ri aworan ti wọ́n ya ẹ̀gbẹ́ ori sinu rẹ̀ profit n ere anfaani he gained profit in his studies o jẹ anfaani ẹ̀kọ́ rẹ̀ profit v.t and i jere it profited him nothing ko jere kankan ninu rẹ̀ profitable n ni ere it was a profitable investment okowo ti o bi ere ni profligate adj nina-ankunaa nifẹ̀ẹ́kufẹ̀ẹ́ niwa buruku he was profligate of his inheritance o na ogun rẹ̀ nina-ankunaa profligate n oniwa buburu orufẹ̀ẹ́kufẹ̀ẹ́ he was a profligate person oniwa buburu eniyan ni profound adj jinlẹ̀ jinlẹ̀ ni imọ̀ he has a profound interest in the case o ni ifẹ́ ti o jinlẹ̀ ninu ọ̀rọ̀ naa profoundness profundity n ijinlẹ̀ imọ̀ ijinlẹ̀ jinjinlẹ̀ they talked about the profundity of his wọ́n sọ̀rọ̀ nipa jinjinlẹ̀ imọ̀ rẹ̀ profuse adj pọ̀ rekọka he gave gratitude to god o fi ọpẹ́ ti o pọ̀ rekọja fun ọlọ́run progenitor n baba nla oduduwa wa the progenitor of the yoruba oduduwa ni baba nla awọn yoruba progeny n irandiran ọmọ the yoruba are the progenies of oduduwa ọmọ oduduwa ni awọn yoruba prognosis n imọ̀tẹ́lẹ̀ isọtẹ́lẹ̀programme n iwe eto ohun ti a o ṣe ni ipade ewe iṣẹ́ eto what are the programmes for tomorrow ki ni awọn eto fun ọ̀la

lines.value: following a celtic after c 450 bc and a roman 9 ad - c 430 ad period the foundation of hungary was laid in the late 9th century by the hungarian ruler arpad whose great grandson saint stephen i was crowned with a crown sent from rome by the pope in 1000 ad the kingdom of hungary lasted for 946 years and at various points was regarded as one of the cultural centers of the western world
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: after about 150 years of partial ottoman occupation 1541-1699 hungary was integrated into the habsburg monarchy and later constituted half of the austro hungarian dual monarchy 1867-1918
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: a great power until the end of world war i hungary lost over 70% of its territory along with one third of its population of hungarian ethnicity and all sea ports under the treaty of trianon the terms of which have been considered excessively harsh by many in hungary
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the kingdom was succeeded by a communist era 1947-1989 during which hungary gained widespread international attention regarding the revolution of 1956 and the unilateral move of opening its border with austria in 1989 thus accelerating the collapse of the eastern bloc
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the present form of government is a parliamentary republic which was established in 1989
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: today hungary is a high income economy and a regional leader in some regards
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: hungary is one of the thirty most popular tourist destinations of the world attracting 8.6 million tourists per year 2007
lines.name: Yoruba

lines.value: the country is home to the largest thermal water cave system and the second largest thermal lake in the world lake heviz the largest lake in central europe lake balaton and the largest natural grasslands in europe hortobagy
lines.name: Yoruba
